definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
ten/10
afternoon/CL:個|个[ge4]/p.m.
morning/CL:個|个[ge4]
noon/midday/CL:個|个[ge4]

afternoon
lunch/CL:份[fen4],頓|顿[dun4],次[ci4],餐[can1]

see 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2]

sentences.english: The table was set for lunch, and the coffee was boiling on the black iron stove.
sentences.chinese: 午餐桌已備好，黑鐵爐上正煮着咖啡。

sentences.english: We had melon for lunch at school.
sentences.chinese: 在學校喫午飯時，我們學校了哈蜜瓜。

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson: Bre you using you mower thellos afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜師長教師今全國午你籌辦用割草機嗎？

sentences.english: Let's meet for lunch and do some speaking practice.
sentences.chinese: 我們午飯時見吧，並做些口語練習。

sentences.english: What's not to like about a refreshing beer on a hot summer afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 炎熱的夏日午後來杯清涼的啤酒怎麼樣？

sentences.english: She  broke the good news to him at lunch.
sentences.chinese: 喫午飯時她向他透露了那則好消息。

sentences.english: I can look for at least two cans of delicacies.
sentences.chinese: 若喫午飯時，葦弟會來，則一定有兩個罐頭的希望。

sentences.english: There's nothing like a Popsicle on a hot summer afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 在盛夏午後來支冰棒是最好不過了。

sentences.english: At lunch time, workers in the fields would make the rice dish in a flat pan over a fire.
sentences.chinese: 午飯時，田地裏的工人們把平底鍋放在火上做海鮮飯。

sentences.english: When the Ambassador of Escalopia returned home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 當艾斯卡羅比亞國的大使回到家喫午飯時。

sentences.english: At noon at about 1 from the start and the rain instant increase.
sentences.chinese: 從中午1時許開始，雨勢瞬間加大。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: I was so hungry today that I ate a mondo bowl of delicious noodles for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 今天我太餓了，所以午飯時吃了一海碗美味的麪條。

sentences.english: I spent the remainder of the afternoon in play.
sentences.chinese: 我把這一下午其餘的時間用在遊戲上了。

sentences.english: We get melon to lunch at educate.
sentences.chinese: 在清華喫午飯時，咱們吃了哈蜜瓜。

sentences.english: Why do not you go for a walk ? It will give you an appetite for your lunch.
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼不出去散散步？散散步午飯時就有食慾了。

sentences.english: We serve three meals, free of charge, at the Restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 費用包括了早，午，晚三餐在酒店的餐館用膳。

definition: 10th earthly branch: 5-7 p.m., 8th solar month (8th September-7th October), year of the Rooster/ancient Chinese compass point: 270° (west)
variant of 卯[mao3]
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
6th earthly branch: 9-11 a.m., 4th solar month (5th May-5th June), year of the Snake/ancient Chinese compass point: 150°
12th earthly branch: 9-11 p.m., 10th solar month (7th November-6th December), year of the Boar/ancient Chinese compass point: 330°
3-5 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
ninth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/ninth in order/letter "I" or Roman "IX" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 345°/nona
fifth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fifth in order/letter "E" or Roman "V" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/penta
tenth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/tenth in order/letter "J" or Roman "X" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 15°/deca
age/seventh of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/seventh in order/letter "G" or Roman "VII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 255°/hepta
old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
first year of the sixty-year cycle (where each year is numbered with one of the 10 heavenly stems 天干[tian1 gan1] and one of the 12 earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1])/the sixty-year cycle
3rd earthly branch: 3-5 a.m., 1st solar month (4th February-5th March), year of the Tiger/ancient Chinese compass point: 60°
surname Mu
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
dusk/evening/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
